intro: Lachenalia alba, commonly known as the white lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces tall, branched stems that bear clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Lachenalia alba is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
